questions.text: What nation produces two thirds of the world's vanilla? Clue: starts with letter M
What is the most widely eaten fish in the world? Clue: starts with H.
What bird was domesticated first? Long neck, wide wings.
What's the common name for a cubic decimeter?
What socialist writer's last words were: "Last words are for fools who haven't said enough"?
What Italian astronomer invented the thermometer in 1592?
Which country gave the USA the 'Statute of Liberty?
What measure of energy comes from the Latin word meaning "heat"?
Who averaged one patent for every three weeks of his life?
What mathematical symbol did math whiz Ferdinand von Lindemann determine to be a transcendental number in 1882?
----- is the strongest bone in the human body.
Your tongue has how many thousand tastebuds?
---- can sleep standing up.
These reptiles breath through their skin.
____________ is the only continent on earth without an active volcano.
----- is the scientific name for 1/100th of a second.
The youngest pope ever was -- years old. Clue: younger than legal age.
____________ is the only planet that rotates clockwise.
____________ is the fear of teeth.
The name of the woman on the statue of liberty is Mother of ------.
